subhead: In Copenhagen, EU heads of state and government debated the role the European Commission should play in coordinating their military efforts. France, Germany and Italy remain particularly reluctant.

title: As migrant drownings continue in the Channel, local solidarity persists
subhead: At least 27 people have lost their lives since the start of the year while attempting to reach England, while more than 33,000 have succeeded. Residents who find indifference intolerable feel compelled to help.

title: Five fun ways to discover Paris and its surroundings with your family
subhead: See the Eiffel Tower from a hot air balloon, take a bus that plunges into the Seine, or ride down the Champs-Elysées in a tuk-tuk: The metro is far from the only way to explore the capital and its surroundings.

title: French students and activists on how they became politicized
subhead: Ahead of another day of protests on October 2, Le Monde spoke to students who became activists in 2025. Their reasons for getting involved ranged from sexual violence and the climate crisis to a sense of outrage over social injustice and precarious living conditions.

subhead: Every day, more natural spaces are being constructed on. Le Monde and its partners analyzed satellite images to measure the causes and the scale of a major transformation: land take.

title: Trump's Gaza plan wins Arab backing, despite frustrations over Israel's influence
subhead: The US president ignored suggestions from Muslim countries, which regret the lack of a clear timetable for Israel's withdrawal from the Gaza Strip.
